author: Sunitha Sekar
text:
Construction material is strewn around GST Road in Meenambakkam

Hundreds of commuters face the risk of accidents as they travel through Meenambakkam going down GST Road, as construction materials and barricades of Chennai Metro Rail are strewn around in a haphazard manner on this section of the arterial road.

It is to be noted that recently, an acrospan from Chennai Metro Rail site in GST Road came crashing down and killed one person. S. Lakshmi, a commuter said, “Sometime ago, I was almost about to skid and fall. Fortunately, it happened just inches before this fallen barricade with sharp rusty edges. I escaped. But when they are spending thousands of crores for construction, is it so difficult to maintain safety standards?”

“There should be safety officers going on inspection to check if norms are followed at any work site. Here, they should be even more careful since it is an area with public access. This lackadaisical attitude, when it comes to following safety, should change,” an expert from IIT-Madras said.

According to officials of Chennai Metro Rail Limited (CMRL), track work is currently going on in that stretch and may be completed soon.

“We will take action to ensure that barricades are put up firmly and remove the materials from the road,” an official said. Currently, construction work is going on beyond Alandur Metro Rail station up to Chennai airport. CMRL officials plan to put this stretch into operation soon.
title: Chennai Metro worksite remains an unsafe zone
